item.title: Notes on Bayesian Statistics
item.description: Sources Student’s Guide to Bayesian Statisitcs, Ben Lambert Part 1 Statisitical Inference sometimes we know the process that generates data (e.g. coin-flip) and so calculating probability is straightforward. when we don’t have perfect knowledge of the process; it is the goal of statistical inference to derive estimates of unknown characteristics or parameters of these data-generating mechanisms. Bayesians start with what is known - the data - and make probabilistic assumptions about the underlying process that generates the data.
